intro: Donax ugandensis, commonly known as the Uganda donax, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly referred to as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, often with a slightly hairy surface. Donax ugandensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along riverbanks.
